nl_problem:
# Task: interval_merger
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: merge(self, arg1)

Given an array of intervals where `intervals[i] = [starti, endi]`, merge all overlapping intervals, and return an array of the non-overlapping intervals that cover all the intervals in the input.

Constraints:
- 1 <= intervals.length <= 10^4
- intervals[i].length == 2
- 0 <= starti <= endi <= 10^4
lisp_spec:
(task
 (name "merge")
 (signature ( (self) (arg1 (list (list int))) ) (list (list int)))
 (constraints
   (constraint "1 <= intervals.length <= 10^4")
   (constraint "intervals[i].length == 2")
   (constraint "0 <= starti <= endi <= 10^4")
 )
 (goal
   (description "Merge all overlapping intervals and return an array of the non-overlapping intervals that cover all the intervals in the input.")
   (rule "Sort intervals by start time, then merge if the current interval overlaps with the previous one.")
   (return "A list of non-overlapping intervals that cover all input intervals.")
 )
)
